article.headline: Detroit 64, Youngstown State 43
article.story: DETROIT (AP) -- Jimmy Twyman scored a career-high 24 points to help Detroit Mercy end a three-game Horizon League losing streak, beating Youngstown State 64-43 on Thursday night. Twyman made all 11 Titans points, including three straight 3-pointers, in an 11-3 streak midway through the first half. Detroit Mercy (10-10, 4-6) led 36-25 at the half and rarely was challenged. Youngstown got as close as nine points early in the second, but the Titans scored four straight to keep the lead in double digits the rest of the way. Khari McQueen led the Penguins (7-13, 3-7) with 11 points and seven rebounds. Youngstown shot just 31 percent, to Detroit Mercy's 46 percent. Ryvon Covile added 11 points while Torvoris Baker pulled down 10 rebounds for Detroit Mercy.
